message.body: test
@yilmazerkan@zv: hi
doesn't zeroboard has like 200 peers?
receiving lots of errors at zeroboard....  "Message submit failed! Parsing parameters... Please try again later."
I tried to answer @erkan@zid:
ahhhh
okay
it is better, but there is a serious 20seconds delay(according to pop-up msg)
I'll eat something, BRB
when you visit a website... does it download everything on the data folder, or it requests only what is necessary to see the website(like clearnet)?
I will assume it downloads everything, and avoid putting large unused files in /data/
how do you know the website size before visiting? and is there a tutorial on how to set a file as optional?
what is the relationship between my public key, my address and the info_hash in my users announce(to a tracker) ?
nevermind
"  tracker.announce(info_hash=hashlib.sha1(self.address).hexdigest(), num_want=50) "
sha1 hash of the address.
why 50 in num_want? most torrent clients set that as -1
http://xbtt.sourceforge.net/udp_tracker_protocol.html
anyway
congratulations on this software, it really rocks
@erkan@zid: are you and @yilmazerkan@zv just one person? you slept what? 5 hours?
I wish we were not using javascript. Tor disables it by default, which tells me it isn't privacy friendly.
zeroboard is not allowing me to post my website. did it start blocking urls or something?
damn... I'm ended up double posting
my bad
@yilmazerkan@zv: post your website(erkan's blog) to new zeronet sites
i usei their db to check peer counts: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LtvsjbtQ2tY7SCtCZzC4KhErqEK3bXD4n/
huh?
why I use "new zeronet sites"?
what logo proposal?
lol
what you meant by logo proposal?
yeah, you are talking about crawling
the thing is... crawling is hard
taking a simple .db file, converting to .csv and then using it, is easy.
I don't know the person who manages that .db website, btw. I just posted my website there, got like 10 peers to seed my website right away. So I think they are good.
the logo you mentioned appears to give a "forbidden" msg. http://localhost:43110/1EGjFGE7AJx1ZkBG3C7QmGLBJGGXFmbR1F/zeromedia.svg
not found: 0net://zeroblog.bit/?Post:65:Discussion:+do+you+want+1+or+more+users+per+site+
@yilmazerkan@zv: the change they are talking about(reducing tracker announce) would probably destroy what I've been coding in the last few days.

@yilmazerkan@zv: also, you talked about crawlers... here is another reason I don't work with HTTP crawling: I have no commitment to the web(browsers, javascript, websockets, etc). The only part that I like about zeronet is that it uses bittorrent.
the further zeronet gets from bittorrent, the more it will suck
updated rank(and rank changes) in http://127.0.0.1:43110/1H567K5Rea47Y3s4JdnCEfAqCNkwDfKMf4/
either zeroboard is bugged or I'm not being allowed to post anymore
It has been more than 20 hours since I last posted
it doesn't display any error
it just says I've posted and that it may take a few minutes
then, half hour later, still nothing
how do I ask the site admin?
ok
here is what happened:
I dragged the zero at the top right
scrolled down, there was a msg saying: missing file: json(or something like that)
it disappeared(I didn't do anything, it just disappeared)
then my "test" msg showed up
http://w3schools.com/
in general, there is a huge difference between hidden service(silk road) or just being a user(silk road's unregistered visitor behiond tor)
the former is much more vulnerable(because it's alway online)
yeah
agree
updated my website: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1H567K5Rea47Y3s4JdnCEfAqCNkwDfKMf4/
peer numbers are extracted from a udp tracker
currently, roughly 24h
yeah, I thought about 4 yesterday, changing to black
because a decrease in rank is good
did they go into the cave together? or could it be like separated by decades between each?
my website went from 100 + something in rank to 48, then dropped, then it has risen again(now to 47th)
when it went from +100th to 48th I was so optmistic, really thought I would break into top30 next day
on the other hand, I went from measuring 200 websites to 300
so maybe I should consider myself luck to somehow float again to top50
:D
this website: http://127.0.0.1:43110/15rc8uWkz14xXPtSbRK7dNbsQMHonzWdqq
is brand new, has 0 pictures, and is among the top40 already
I will put on some cat ears, post to my website and see if it makes more popular, lol
guess people really like cats... just the prospect of having cat pictures in the future is enough o_O
@yilmazerkan@zv: you are right about every website having "-zeronet" even if you remove that from your content.json, it still shows up on the browser
very calm day on zeronet
@flyman@zid: don't know. probably. this is my first sunday at zeronet.
maybe you guys should rename "content.json" to "dont_delete.json"
@yilmazerkan@zv: not me. but many (new)users delete/rename it.
my website took a hit... holy crap...
I fell 35 positions in one day
I'm being unable to post my link on zeroboard...
nevermind
it just showed up
sorry for the double post, my first post didn't show up after 30 minutes
one of the most calm days on zeronet
no major change in the top 20
@yilmazerkan@zv: folks were talking about webRTC yesterday
I didn't jump in, but honestly: I wish we were not using browsers/webRTC
everything related to browsers seems designed to spy on users
webRTC, if I remember correctly, requires a public/private key fro everybody
my first thought would be: do they change that key pair(after closing the browser)? or is it used to track people?
